intro: Sarcomelicope leiocarpa, commonly known as the white-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
